mobs.long_desc: Huitzipa the nemesis of war is sleeping here.
mobs.desc: Before you is the Technitzitlan nemesis of war.  He looks mean as you notice many the many bony plates and spikes covering his body.  His claws don't look overly inviting either.  You better run while you still can!

mobs.long_desc: Xapizo the nemesis of death is sleeping here.
mobs.desc: Before you is the Technitzitlan nemesis of death.  He wavers into and out of reality as you try to look at him closely.  Xapizo looks almost completely emaciated and strikes fear into you as you consider this living giant skeleton.

mobs.long_desc: A gale wind is here howling at the earth.
mobs.desc: You notice something rather different about this breeze, it's alive!  It doesn't look very happy with you either.  Can you outrun the wind?

mobs.long_desc: A trainee of the Leopard Order stands here guarding the snow.
mobs.desc: Before you stands a warrior in training.  He is fixed upon his current duties and looks well disciplined.  He could probably do you harm, so stay clear.

mobs.long_desc: A trainee of the Leopard Order stands here guarding the snow.
mobs.desc: Before you stands a warrior in training.  She is fixed upon her current duties and looks well disciplined.  She could probably do you harm, so stay clear.

mobs.long_desc: An apprentice to the Leopard Shaman is here practicing spells.
mobs.desc: Before you stands an apprentice in training.  He is focused upon learning the many spells and discipline it takes to be a shaman of the leopard order.  He looks intent on guarding his home, so stay clear.

mobs.long_desc: An apprentice to the Leopard Shaman is here practicing spells.
mobs.desc: Before you stands an apprentice in training.  She is focused upon learning the many spells and discipline it takes to be a shaman of the leopard order.  She looks intent on guarding her home, so stay clear.

mobs.long_desc: A Knight of the Leopard Order stands here guarding his home.
mobs.desc: You look upon a strong and battle scarred Knight of the Leopard Order.  He looks serene as he stands guard vigilantly over his homeland.  The knight takes orders from a higher authority and looks mean in his battleworn armors.

mobs.keywords: knight leopard order warrior female knight-female
mobs.long_desc: A knight of the Leopard Order stands here guarding her home.
mobs.desc: You look upon a strong and battle scarred Knight of the Leopard Order.  She looks serene as she stands guard vigilantly over her homeland.  The knight takes order from a higher authority and looks mean in her battle worn armors.

mobs.long_desc: A Leopard Shaman is here training minions of the order.
mobs.desc: You look upon a confident and wise person who has been through many battles. He looks at you casually with passing interest and arrogance.  He must be a powerful person to disregard you so.  His robes and staff make him look as though he may be an important person in this society.

mobs.long_desc: A Leopard Shaman is here training minions of the order.
mobs.desc: You look upon a confident and wise person who has been through many battles. She looks at you casually with passing interest and arrogance.  She must be a powerful person to disregard you so.  Her robes and staff make her look as though she may be an important person in this society.

mobs.keywords: champion leopard order warrior knight champion-leopard knight-champion
mobs.long_desc: The Knight Champion of the Leopard Order looks down upon you.
mobs.desc: This is a big man.  His look is wise and battleworn.  He looks strong and agile as his many years as Champion of the order have given him vast experience in the art of combat.  He observes you with a skeptical eye.

mobs.keywords: master shaman leopard high master-leopard-shaman master-shaman
mobs.long_desc: The Master Shaman of the Snow Leopard Kingdom is here contemplating.
mobs.desc: This woman is very beautiful and seems powerful by her nature.  She is dressed in fine flowing robes and there is an aura of power radiating from where she floats.  She mumbles something about regret of her predecessors losing the focus that helps bind great evil powers in the kingdom.  She speaks of battles with demons and barbarians.  She seems upset.

mobs.keywords: snow polar bear white skin it polar-bear snow-white
mobs.long_desc: A large snow white bear looks at you with interest.
mobs.desc: This creature is large and it looks hungry as it searches for food.  It prowls and looks at you hungrily, better hope it's eaten recently.

mobs.long_desc: A golem of solid ice stands here next to the altar.
mobs.desc: You look upon a statue over eight feet tall of solid ice.  It glows strangely and looks almost alive.  The sneer on the face of this creature tells you it does not like you around.  You wonder what it is guarding?

mobs.long_desc: A golem of solid granite stands here next to the portal.
mobs.desc: You look upon a statue over eight feet tall of solid granite.  It glows strangely and looks almost alive.  The sneer on the face of this creature tells you it does not like you around.  You wonder what it is guarding?

mobs.long_desc: A traveling merchant walks about here contemplating deals.
mobs.desc: This man looks rather travel worn and weary.  He scans the horizon as if looking for a purpose in his life.  He offers many deals and looks as though he could con even you.

mobs.keywords: ice snake snow white ice-snake strange-looking
mobs.long_desc: A strange-looking white snake slithers about the ice.
mobs.desc: You barely notice what looks like a piece of the ice slither at you.  It stalks you slowly and you sense it's ready to strike!

mobs.keywords: Suralla Iceeye cunning mage blue-shrouded Questmaster
mobs.long_desc: A cunning blue-shrouded mage is here.
mobs.desc: Suralla is slender, even for a mage.  Her eyes are a dark, crystaline blue, glowing softly.  See seems to look everywhere and no where all at once, sweeping her eyes across the room.  She is covered in clothing, but nothing identifiable as one particular garment.  There is a lone blue shape embedded on the back side of her right hand.

objects.ground: A jade-encrusted club of solid granite is hidden among the rocks.

extras.text: You look at a large granite club fashioned with many jade gems.  The club has many symbols carved into it as though they are a history of some battles.

objects.ground: A large ring of solid jade lies here.

extras.text: This is a large ring carved from a solid piece of jade.  It looks as though it is made up of many symbols that resemble squared cerimonial masks.

objects.ground: A book of ancient script lies here on the verge of fading to dust.

extras.text: This ancient script contains the verse to many powerful spells.  It's covered in many strange symbols and bound by a large leather strap.  It looks as though it may disintegrate in your hands at any moment.

objects.ground: An ancient book lies here on the edge of destruction.

extras.text: You look upon a powerful verse of war and destruction.

objects.ground: A skull of pure crystal lies here barely noticeable, almost invisible.

extras.text: You hold the sacred treasured skull of the Technitzitlan Shaman.

objects.ground: A fountain of black granite dominates the plaza.

extras.text: The stone of the fountain is adorned with many symbols that seem to tell a story of battle and honor.  Four small statues of the Snow Leopard adorn the fountain.

objects.ground: A crystalline club encrusted with jade jewels lies here.

extras.text: This club is mysteriously transparent and there is a vien of pure blue flowing through it.  All about the club are jaden gems of brilliant green.

objects.ground: A pelt of pure white fur and dark spots is piled in a corner.

extras.text: In your hands is the cloak made from the pelt of a snow leopard, valuable beyond anything else to the people of Technitzitlan.  It is said that those who wear such a cloak are closer to the great Snow Leopard herself than anyone else.

objects.ground: A polar bear skin sewn into some pants lies abandoned here.

extras.text: These pants seem well made.  Stitched from polar bear hide, they are warm and protective.  The white fur still shines like it were yours.

objects.ground: A pure white cloak is hidden in the snow.

extras.text: You hold a snow white short cloak.  It's just long and wide enough to cover your shoulders and half of your back.  Its fur lining keeps you warm and offers some protection.

objects.ground: A large piece of jade carved like a cat's eye hangs here on an strand of gold.

extras.text: You hold a palm sized, polished dark green jade medallion.  It seems to be warm to the touch.  In the green of the medalion are two crystal blue veins forming what looks like a cats eye.

objects.ground: A helmet resembling the head of a leopard lies here.

extras.text: It is a solid white helm, lined in fur with black spots patched onto it.  The pattern of the front above the forehead is dyed to resemble they eyes of a cat.

objects.ground: A crystal green girth lies here folded into a pile.

extras.text: This heavy piece of armor seems to be made of pure green crystal.  It glows slightly and is warm to the touch.  Just looking at it makes you feel brave.

objects.ground: A strange golden diadem is gleaming through the dust.

extras.text: Light seems to flow naturally from this ancient golden medallion.  Symbols of what look like stars in the heavens are spread across it, and there is a symbol of the sun dominating its center.

objects.ground: A small circle of ice catches your eye.

extras.text: It looks as though it's a simple ring carved from ice, although upon closer inspection you notice that the small ring is made of tiny carved square ceremonial masks.

objects.ground: A long staff of clear crystal lies on the ground.

extras.text: This staff looks like any gnarled wooden staff, except it's pure clear crystal with a vein of deep blue running through it.  It must have been created from magic.

objects.ground: A wand of crystal lies here in the snow.

extras.text: You hold a simple, small crystal stick.  It has a brilliant streak of red running through its center.  The red glows slightly.

objects.ground: A dagger in the shape of a long fang lies abandoned here.

extras.text: The weapon has a long thin blade that looks as though it could do quite a bit of damage if used properly.  The most distinguishing feature is the handel that looks to be made from the tooth of a giant carnivore.

objects.ground: What looks like a clear fang of a snake lies here.

extras.text: This looks to be a piece of clear crystal constructed from magic to protect it owner in an attack.  It looks like the fang of a beast of prey.

objects.ground: A small circle of black stone catches your eye.

extras.text: Made of a dark granite inset with tiny crystals, it has been fashioned into a ring and polished until the black stone both catches and absorbs the light.

objects.ground: A large black key of solid stone lies here.

extras.text: It's a key made of the black volcanic stone basalt.

objects.ground: A pile of fur and cloth has been abandoned here.

extras.text: This garmet is white in color much like the region it comes from.  It is highlighted with a mysterious silvery sash with many symbols on it.  It looks to be very warm.

objects.ground: A golden stone in the shape of a tear catches your eye.

extras.text: This is a small gold nugget that looks as though it were carved from another piece, it has rough scrapes on it and you wonder where it came from.

objects.ground: A small and heavy looking pile of fur lies here.

extras.text: You look upon a small snow white fur skirt.  The fur lines the inside and outside with hundreds of small rings forming ringmail sandwiched between the fur linings.  It looks quite warm and protective.

objects.ground: A pool of glowing, silvery energy pulsates here.

extras.text: The glow from the pool casts a quicksilver haze about the entire shrine.  The liquid pulsates with energy and the surface is almost ethereal.

objects.ground: A pool of glowing, silvery energy pulsates here.

extras.text: The glow from the pool casts a quicksilver haze about the entire shrine.  The liquid pulsates with energy and the surface is almost ethereal.

objects.ground: A pool of glowing, silvery energy pulsates here.

extras.text: The glow from the pool casts a quicksilver haze about the entire shrine.  The liquid pulsates with energy and the surface is almost ethereal.

objects.ground: A pool of glowing, silvery energy pulsates here.

extras.text: The glow from the pool casts a quicksilver haze about the entire shrine.  The liquid pulsates with energy and the surface is almost ethereal.

objects.ground: A ripped and torn, rune-covered bag lies here.

extras.text: A massive bag made of thick leather, the outer layer has been ripped and torn to shreds, obscuring the silvery runes that once covered it.  Bits and pieces of them can be seen, but never enough to be read.  Whatever was holding on to this bag probably liked the bag but not the runes.

objects.ground: A tiny indigo silk pouch rests on the ground.

extras.text: Upon closer inspection, you see this small hand-sized pouch has been sewn shut on all four sides like a pillow or cushion.  Inside you hear the crunching of dried herbs, which from the fragrance you would guess to be bay and thyme. Such pouches like this are called sachets.  They are commonly used in place of perfume, or to diffuse the scent of herbs in magical workings.

objects.ground: A tiny indigo silk pouch rests on the ground.

extras.text: The sweet, spicy smell of this incense is deep and bold.  It combines cinnamon, associated with psychic strength, with rose, which can be used in divinations in addition to its traditional place in love magic.  Glistening with flecks of gemstone dust, this incense is a potent magical ingredient!

objects.ground: A crystal ball rests on a small stand here.

extras.text: This large crystalline orb is the perfect tool for divination magic, particularly for scrying.  Cleansed and hand-picked by the Oracle of Justice, this crystal ball was chosen exclusively for you!

triggers.name: quest_cryo_greet
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% eval minlevel (%wandstep% - 1) * 10 if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I see you're crafting something.  If you want my help, we can talk about &6&b[upgrades]&0.' else if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask1]% && %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask2]% && %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:wandtask3]% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I sense you're ready!  Let me see the staff.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have what I need for the %weapon%?' endif endif endif endif switch %actor.quest_stage[subclass]% case 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Welcome back.' wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'It will take a great mage with a dedication to the cold arts to complete the &6&bquest&0 I lay before you.  Your reward is simple if you succeed, and I am sure you will enjoy a life of the cold.' break case 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I see you return.' wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Recall, what Emmath and I battled over may still be &6&bsuffering&0.' break case 3 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Why have you returned already?  The shrub still suffers!' break case 4 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Does the shrub still suffer?' break default if %actor.class% /= sorcerer switch %actor.race% case dragonborn_fire case arborean halt break default if %actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 45 grin %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Greetings %actor.name%, have you come to me for a specific &6&breason&0?' eye %actor.name% elseif %actor.level% < 10 grin %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Greetings %actor.name%.  I fear we are meeting before you are ready.  Gain some more experience, then seek me out again.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I look forward to our next encounter.' endif done endif done

triggers.name: Tech_Master_Shaman_1
triggers.commands: *Add Kourrya 6-06, loading for the Minithawkin troll mask quest if %actor.race% /= troll mjunk mangrove-branch mload obj 37080 endif wait 2 * * for Wizard Eye * if ((%actor.class% /= Sorcerer || %actor.class% /= Illusionist) && %actor.level% > 80) || %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == 5 if (%actor.class% /= Sorcerer || %actor.class% /= Illusionist) && %actor.level% > 80 set stage %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% switch %stage% case 1 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You best seek out the gypsy witch.  Without her advice, I cannot help you further.' break case 2 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Have you brought what the witch suggested?' break case 3 case 4 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'How is the Seer in her cave on Griffin Isle?  I have not seen her for many years!' break case 5 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Have you brought what the Seer suggested?' break case 6 case 7 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Before you return to me, speak with the Green Woman in Anduin.  She has learned a great many things from her post behind the counter.' break case 8 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Have you brought what the Green Woman suggested?' break case 9 case 10 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'The orbs are far too dangerous to bring back here without consulting the Oracle of Justice!' if %actor.inventory[3218]% || %actor.inventory[53424]% || %actor.inventory[43021]% || %actor.inventory[4003]% || %actor.wearing[3218]% || %actor.wearing[53424]% || %actor.wearing[43021]% || %actor.wearing[4003]% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Leave my chamber before these orbs corrupt it!' msend %actor% %self.name% shoves you back out into the hallway! mechoaround %actor% %self.name% shoves %actor.name% back out into the hallway! mteleport %actor.name% 55073 mat 55073 mforce %actor.name% look endif break case 11 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I see you have returned enlightened!  Let me see the crystal ball and I shall make the preparations.' break case 12 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Come, &6&bsleep&0, let your dreams impart mastery of divination to you.' break default if !%actor.has_completed[wizard_eye]% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'You are more powerful than most visitors.  Have you come to see as the Great Snow Leopard does?' endif break done if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == 5 if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 peer %actor% wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Or perhaps you come about a crafting &6&b[upgrade]&0...' else msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Or have you brought the necessary components for the wand?' endif endif endif * * for phase wands * if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == 5 set job1 %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand:wandtask1]% set job2 %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand:wandtask2]% set job3 %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand:wandtask3]% set job4 %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand:wandtask4]% if %actor.level% >= 40 if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'I see you're crafting something.  If you come for the Great Snow Leopard's help, let's discuss an &6&b[upgrade]&0.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == 5 && %job1% && %job2% && %job3% && %job4% msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'It looks like the wand is ready for upgrading!  Please give it to me.' else msend %actor% %self.name% tells you, 'Do you have what I need for the wand?' endif endif endif * * This is the original greet trig for the shaman quest * else msend %actor% %self.name% raises an eyebrow. msend %actor% %self.name% mutters something about people disturbing her while she considers what to do about what's missing. msend %actor% %self.name% grumbles incoherently about something or other. endif

triggers.name: Tech_Master_Shaman_2
triggers.commands: * This is the initial conversation to get quest data mecho The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 rolls her eyes in disgust. msend %actor% The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 whispers to you, 'Yes, my predecessors and ancestors lost many msend %actor% &0battles with demons and a cult of the followers of Lokari and in the process msend %actor% &0lost the keys.' mechoaround %actor% The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 speaks in a low voice to %actor.name%. mecho The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 pulls out her unused thinking cap, and begins to think.

triggers.name: Tech_Master_Shaman_3
triggers.commands: * Yet more quest information mechoaround %actor% The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 raises an eyebrow at %actor.name%. msend %actor% The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 raises an eyebrow at you. mechoaround %actor% The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 speaks to %actor.name% in a low voice. msend %actor% The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 whispers to you, 'Yes, Huitzipa the war god and that cursed msend %actor% &0death god, I can't even say his name.' mecho The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 spits over her shoulder. mechoaround %actor% The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 speaks to %actor.name% in a low voice. msend %actor% The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 whispers to you, 'If it weren't for the great Snow Leopard of msend %actor% &0the ancient age, our kingdom would have perished long long ago.' mecho The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 nods to herself.

triggers.name: Tech_Master_Shaman_4
triggers.commands: * Still more quest banter mecho The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 nods. mechoaround %actor% The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 speaks to %actor.name% in a low voice. msend %actor% The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 whispers to you, 'Whatever they are, no one even remembers msend %actor% &0anymore.  They are just the means by which the greatest evils my kingdom has msend %actor% &0ever known can be set free again.' mecho The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 frowns.

triggers.name: Tech_Master_Shaman_5
triggers.commands: * More quest conversation mecho The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 blinks. mechoaround %actor% The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 speaks to %actor.name% in a low voice. msend %actor% The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 whispers to you, 'How dare you repeat that vile name in my msend %actor% &0presence!  If it were not for the Great Leopard we would be lost.  The msend %actor% &0injustice and recklessness of them, I wish him destroyed!' mecho The &3&bMaster Shaman&0 growls.

triggers.name: Master Shaman receive tear
triggers.commands: wait 1 eye %actor.name% mjunk golden say This looks like one of the legendary keys! wait 2 thank %actor.name% wait 2 say Oh thank you!  Take this as a reward. mload obj 55019 give fang %actor.name% drop fang

triggers.name: Master Shaman skull receive
triggers.commands: wait 2 set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if !%person.quest_stage[tech_mysteries_quest]% quest start tech_mysteries_quest %person.name% endif quest variable tech_mysteries_quest %person.name% cloak 1 elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done mjunk skull say Oh my!  You have destroyed a great evil!  My kingdom will never be threatened by it again! wait 2 thank %actor.name% wait 2 say I know the Snow Leopard would want you to have this! mload obj 55008 give cloak %actor.name% drop cloak

triggers.name: Master Shaman refuse
triggers.commands: set stage %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% switch %object.vnum% case %wandgem% case %wandvnum% case %wandtask3% halt break case 58609 if %stage% == 2 halt endif break case 55030 if %stage% == 5 halt endif break case 55032 if %stage% == 8 halt endif break case 55033 if %stage% == 11 halt endif done if %stage% == 2 set response Is %object.shortdesc% really what she sent you to find? elseif %stage% == 5 || %stage% == 8 set response Is %object.shortdesc% really what she suggested you use? elseif %stage% == 11 set response What?  %object.shortdesc%?  This can't be right. else set response What is this? endif if %response% return 0 eye %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, '%response%' mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. endif

triggers.name: Knight_Champ_speech1
triggers.commands: spit mechoaround %actor% The Knight Champion speaks in a low voice to %actor.name%. msend %actor% The Knight Champion whispers to you, 'Xapizo the nemesis of death and that war msend %actor% &0god!' wait 1s growl mechoaround %actor% The Knight Champion speaks in a low voice to %actor.name%. msend %actor% The Knight Champion whispers to you, 'They were nearly our undoing!' wait 1s eye msend %actor% The Knight Champion whispers to you, 'To destroy Xapizo, now there would be a msend %actor% &0battle to earn respect! I wish I were so strong.'

triggers.name: Knight_Champ_speech2
triggers.commands: nod mechoaround %actor% The Knight Champion speaks in a low voice to %actor.name%. msend %actor% The Knight Champion whispers to you, 'Yes there was evil in the kingdom long msend %actor% &0ago two reckless deities warring. The great Snow Leopard saved us all.'

triggers.name: Knight_Champ_speech3
triggers.commands: nod %actor.name% mechoaround %actor% The Knight Champion speaks in a low voice to %actor.name%. msend %actor% The Knight Champion whispers to you 'Yes a victory in battle over a foe of msend %actor% &0great evil.  Or an army of the darkness.'

triggers.name: Knight_Champ_speech4
triggers.commands: trip %actor.name% mecho %self.name% says, 'You are unworthy!  Standing here like a helpless mecho &0pig!' growl

triggers.name: Knight_Champ_speech5
triggers.commands: mechoaround %actor% The Knight Champion speaks in a low voice to %actor.name%. msend %actor% The Knight Champion whispers to you 'Yes prove you are worthy of honour and msend %actor% &0respect.' think wait 1s msend %actor% The Knight Champion whispers to you 'Perhaps win a great victory over a great msend %actor% &0evil.'

triggers.name: Knight_Champ_rece
triggers.commands: * Knight Champion Receive object for quest goodie if %object.vnum% == 55004 wait 1 set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if !%person.quest_stage[tech_mysteries_quest]% quest start tech_mysteries_quest %person.name% endif quest variable tech_mysteries_quest %person.name% girth 1 elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done mecho %self.name% says, 'You did it!  You have the book!  The only way would have been to venture to the planes and destroy Xapizo!' mjunk codex say I know the Snow Leopard would want you to have this. mload obj 55013 give girth %actor.name% drop girth else wait 1 eye %actor.name% endif

triggers.name: Knight_Champ_greet
triggers.commands: msend %actor% The Knight Champion raises his eyebrow at you. msend %actor% The Knight Champion says, 'Hrmm?  More worthless dogs come to prove your msend %actor% &0worth?'

triggers.name: quest_suralla_speak1
triggers.commands: if %actor.class% /= Sorcerer switch %actor.race% case dragonborn_fire case arborean if (%actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 45) msend %actor% &1Your race cannot subclass to cryomancer.&0 endif halt break default wait 2 if (%actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 45) msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you wish to become a mage mastering the elements of ice and water and wind?' elseif %actor.class% /= Sorcerer && %actor.level% < 10 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Come back to me once you've gained more experience.' elseif %actor.class% /= Sorcerer && %actor.level% > 45 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Unfortunately you are too dedicated to your universalist ways for me to teach you now.' endif done endif

triggers.name: quest_suralla_yesno
triggers.commands: if %actor.class% /= Sorcerer switch %actor.race% case dragonborn_fire case arborean if (%actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 45) msend %actor% &1Your race cannot subclass to cryomancer.&0 endif halt break default wait 2 if %speech% /= yes if (%actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 45) quest start cryomancer_subclass %actor.name% Cry nod msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'It will take a great mage with a dedication to the cold arts to complete the &6&bquest&0 I lay before you.  Your reward is simple if you succeed, and I am sure you will enjoy a life of the cold.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'At any time you may check your &6&b[subclass progress]&0.' elseif %actor.level% < 10 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Come back to me once you've gained more experience.' elseif %actor.class% /= Sorcerer && %actor.level% > 45 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Unfortunately you are too dedicated to your universalist ways for me to teach you now.' endif else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Very well, begone.  I feel like I have wasted time now thanks to you.' sigh msend %actor% Suralla blinks several times at you, then it becomes very bright indeed! mechoaround %actor%  Suralla begins blinking at %actor.name% who is suddenly taken away in a flash of light. mteleport %actor.name% 55015 endif done endif

triggers.name: quest_suralla_speak2
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[cryomancer_subclass]% == 1 quest advance cryomancer_subclass %actor.name% wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'It is quite simple.' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'My counterpart, the great Emmath Firehand, long ago battled with me once.' emote reminisces for a brief moment, looking thoughtful. wait 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'It was not serious by any means, but it did end in a stalemate.  The catch however...' wait 1s sigh wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, '... is that what we battled over may still be &6&bsuffering&0.' emote sighs deeply again. endif

triggers.name: quest_suralla_speak3
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[cryomancer_subclass]% == 2 wait 1s emote smiles sadly. wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'It is a shame really, that poor shrub, it really was an innocent in all of that.' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I do feel bad about it.  The poor thing tried to flee us and sought the shaman who created him.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I do not know if that will help you end his suffering or not, but I hope it does.' wait 2s grin wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'And the reward will be great if you do.  The shrub muttered something about a place with rushing water and some odd warriors being his safety.' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Oh!  One last thing.  When you return to claim your reward, be sure to say to me &6&b"the shrub suffers no longer"&0, and the prize will be yours.' wait 2s smile wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Go about it now.' quest advance cryomancer_subclass %actor.name% endif

triggers.name: Wizard Eye Master Shaman receive 1
triggers.commands: set stage %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% if %stage% == 2 wait 2 mjunk %object% quest advance wizard_eye %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Ah, marigold for clairvoyance.  That makes sense.  I will store it while you seek the advice of the next sage.' msend %actor% %self.name% tucks the marigold poultice away in her chamber. wait 5s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'There are a handful of true visionaries in Ethilien, but one stands out among the rest.  The &6&bSeer of Griffin Isle&0 always receives the most cryptic of visions.' wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Whatever a "sun screen" is I have no idea, but she speaks of it often.' ponder wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Often I am forced to question her sanity...' wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Regardless of her mental state, she is a truly master diviner.  &6&bVisit her&0 and see what she recommends you do to attune to your future crystal ball.' endif

triggers.name: quest_suralla_burningshrub_dead
triggers.commands: mecho %self.name% says, 'Thank you for ending my pain.' set person %actor% set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 unset person while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[cryomancer_subclass]% == 3 quest advance cryomancer_subclass %person.name% endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done elseif %person.quest_stage[cryomancer_subclass]% == 3 quest advance cryomancer_subclass %person.name% endif

triggers.name: quest_suralla_endquest
triggers.commands: wait 2 switch %actor.quest_stage[cryomancer_subclass]% case 1 case 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Interesting, how could you have completed the quest without actually knowing what it is?' break case 3 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Nay, you did not partake in ending its suffering.' break case 4 thank %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Thank you so very much for righting my wrong.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'It is for the best.' wait 2s bow %actor.name% wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Type &6&b'subclass'&0 to proceed.' quest complete cryomancer_subclass %actor.name% break default msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'What is going on?  The voices again, it is all happening again......' wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Wait, I seem to remember something about a quest...  Pity you were not on it.' done

triggers.name: quest_suralla_opening
triggers.commands: if %arg% /= ice || %arg% /= sculpture wsend %actor%  The light of the ice sculpture swirls around you and you find yourself moving. wechoaround %actor% %actor.name% looks at the ice sculpture and is engulfed by light. wdoor 55015 south room 55000 wechoaround %actor% The ice sculpture splits in two and %actor.name% is sucked through by a strong gust! wsend %actor% The ice sculpture splits in two and you are sucked through by a strong gust! wat 55000 wecho There is a sudden split in the wall of ice! wforce %actor% south wait 1 wdoor 55015 south purge wecho The sculpture seals behind %actor.o%. else return 0 endif

The poor thing tried to flee us and sought the shaman who created him.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I do not know if that will help you end his suffering or not, but I hope it does.' grin wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'And the reward will be great if you do. wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'The shrub muttered something about a place with rushing water and some odd warriors being his safety.' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Oh! When you return to claim your reward, be sure to say to me &6&b"The shrub suffers no longer"&0, and the prize will be yours.' smile msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Go about it now. break case 4 wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Say &6&b"The shrub suffers no longer"&0, and the prize will be yours.' break default if %actor.class% /= Sorcerer switch %actor.race% case dragonborn_fire case arborean if (%actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 45) msend %actor% &1Your race cannot subclass to cryomancer.&0 endif break default wait 2 if (%actor.level% >= 10 && %actor.level% <= 45) msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You are not yet on my quest.' elseif %actor.level% < 10 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Come back to me once you've gained more experience.' elseif %actor.class% /= Sorcerer && %actor.level% > 45 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Unfortunately you are too dedicated to your universalist ways for me to teach you now.' endif done endif done

triggers.name: wizard_eye_shaman_speech1
triggers.commands: wait 2 set stage %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% if (%actor.class% /= Sorcerer || %actor.class% /= Illusionist) if (%actor.level% > 80) if %stage% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Ah, so you wish to gain the Sight of the Great Snow Leopard.' nod wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Yes, I can teach you this spell.  But casting it is much more complicated than simple words and gestures.  You will need a uniquely attuned crystal ball to scry upon.' wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'There are four other master diviners in the world. You will need to visit each one to figure out which items are best attuned to you.' wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Let us start with the one furthest away.  There is a &6&bgypsy witch who dwells in South Caelia&0.  Find her and &6&bask what you will need for Wizard Eye&0.' quest start wizard_eye %actor.name% wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You may return to me and check your &6&b[spell progress]&0 at any time.' elseif %stage% == 2 || %stage% == 5 || %stage% == 8 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Give it to me then, please.' endif else shake msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You are not ready to learn such advanced magics.  Meddling with divinations you are not prepared to handle can rip your mind apart!  I will not be responsible for such a thing again...' endif else shake msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'That spell is outside your ability to cast.' endif

triggers.name: wizard_eye_gypsy_speech
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% == 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Why yes, I can help with that!  So you want your own crystal ball, ya say?' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, '&6&bShow&0 me your &6&bpalm&0.' endif

triggers.name: wizard_eye_gypsy_command
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% == 1 && (%arg% /= palm || %arg% /= hand) msend %actor% You show your palm to %self.name%. wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% looks at your palm for a long moment. wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Hmmmmm...' wait 2s mdamage %actor% 5 msend %actor% %self.name% suddenly stabs your hand with a knife! &1(%damdone%)&0 mechoaround %actor% %self.name% suddenly stabs %actor.name%'s hand with a knife!  &1(%damdone%)&0 msend %actor% %self.name% watches the blood drip from your hand. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% watches the blood drip from %actor.name%'s hand. wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Ah, I see.  All you need is a simple &3&bmarigold poultice&0.  It's popular with the healers out on the beachhead.  I'm sure you can "procure" some from one of them.' wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'When the time comes, smear it on both your face and the crystal ball.  I'll send a note ahead to the Master Shaman.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Good luck!  Come back and see me sometime!' wave quest advance wizard_eye %actor.name% else return 0 endif

triggers.name: wizard_eye_seer_greet
triggers.commands: wait 2 eval minlevel (%wandstep% - 1) * 10 if %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% == 3 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I had a feeling you would show up soon.  The shaman from Technitzitlan has sent you to me, yes?' if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% wait 1s if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Or is there some other reason you're here?' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have what I need for the staff?' endif endif endif elseif %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% == 4 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have the herbs? if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% wait 1s if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Or is there some other reason you're here?' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'And do you have what I need for the staff?' endif endif endif elseif %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I've been expecting you!  Tell me, what brings you to me?' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have what I need for the staff?' endif endif endif

triggers.name: wizard_eye_seer_speech
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% == 3 quest advance wizard_eye %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'As I suspected.' peer %actor% wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'So you want to learn Wizard Eye do you?  No simple feat, that.' wait 4s emote tents her fingers and paces back and forth. msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Now, what is best for you, hmmmm?' wait 4s eye %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Perhaps an infusion of poppies?' wait 4s shake msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Nah.  Overkill.' wait 4s point %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Perhaps basilisk oil?' wait 2s shake msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'No, extinct.' wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Wait, I see it!' Wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'A sachet of oracular herbs!  Yes!  For prophetic dreams!' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I can make it for you too, if you bring me the materials. msend %actor% I need the following: msend %actor% - &5%get.obj_shortdesc[48005]%&0 msend %actor% - &2Thyme&0 msend %actor% - &2&bBay&0 msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% &3&bBring these back to me&0 and I'll get you on your way.  I'll send a note to the Master Shaman in the meantime.' endif

triggers.name: wizard_eye_seer_receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% == 4 switch %object.vnum% case 2329 set item 1 break case 23753 set item 2 break case 48005 set item 3 done if %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item%item%]% return 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You already brought me this!' msend %actor% %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. else quest variable wizard_eye %actor.name% item%item% 1 wait 2 mjunk %object% nod msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Yep, this'll do.' if %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item1]% && %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item2]% && %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item3]% quest advance wizard_eye %actor.name% set item 1 while %item% <= 4 quest variable wizard_eye %actor.name% item%item% 0 eval item %item% + 1 done wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Let me just stitch up a little bag for you.' wait 1s emote cuts a large square from the indigo silk dress. emote quickly sews the square into a little pouch. emote fills the pouch with the thyme and bay leaves and stitches it shut. wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Here ya go!' mload obj 55030 give sachet %actor.name% wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Sweet dreams!' cackle else wait 2 if !%actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item1]% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'What about the bay?' endif if !%actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item3]% wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Did you find a dress I can upcycle?' endif if !%actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item2]% wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Oh and do you have the thyme?' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Of course you don't, you don't have a wristwatch!' laugh wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'No but really, if you have it, give it to me.' endif endif endif endif

triggers.name: wizard_eye_apothecary_greet
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.vnum% == -1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'What can I get for ya dearie?' if %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% == 6 wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Hmmm, there's something odd about you.  What have you come for?' endif endif

triggers.name: wizard_eye_apothecary_speech
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %speech% /= wizard eye || %speech% /= the shaman sent me || %speech% /= crystal ball if %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% == 6 quest advance wizard_eye %actor.name% grin msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Well then that's a different sort of brew!' wait 1s peer %actor% wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'No, not a brew...  But perhaps... a smell?' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Yes, that should do it!  Incense to increase your psychic reach is what you need.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Two things that work very well together are &1roses&0 and &1cinnamon&0. wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Cinnamon is fairly straight-forward.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Roses, on the other hand, may be more tricky...' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You need three varieties.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Two varieties of roses grow in Mielikki, one &1red&0 and one &9&bblack&0.  Bring back one of each.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'A third kind is carried by serpents in Dargentan's sky tower.  Even though it's &4&bmade of sapphire&0 which is not the best for divination, it'll lend extra potency to the attunement process.' wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Bring me these ingredients and I'll make you a lovely incense.' endif endif

triggers.name: wizard_eye_apothecary_receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% == 7 switch %object.vnum% case 23754 set item 1 break case 3298 set item 2 break case 23847 set item 3 break case 18001 set item 4 done if %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item%item%]% return 0 msend %actor% %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You already brought me %object.shortdesc%.' else quest variable wizard_eye %actor.name% item%item% 1 mjunk %object.name% wait 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Ah, %object.shortdesc%.' wait 4 if %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item1]% && %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item2]% && %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item3]% && %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item4]% quest advance wizard_eye %actor.name% set item 1 while %item% <= 4 quest variable wizard_eye %actor.name% item%item% 0 eval item %item% + 1 done msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'That looks like everything.  Let me grind this all up!' wait 2s emote pulls out a mortar and pestle from behind the counter. wait 1s emote grinds the roses and cinnamon to a fine powder and shapes it into a small brick. wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'This incense should be perfect for you!' mload obj 55032 give incense %actor.name% wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Be careful!' grin %actor.name% else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have the rest of the ingredients?' endif endif endif

triggers.name: wizard_eye_oracle_receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% == 10 switch %object.vnum% case 3218 set item 1 break case 53424 set item 2 break case 43021 set item 3 break case 4003 set item 4 done if %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item%item%]% return 0 msend %actor% %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You already brought me %object.shortdesc%.' else quest variable wizard_eye %actor.name% item%item% 1 wait 2 mjunk %object.name% if %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item1]% && %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item2]% && %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item3]% && %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item4]% quest advance wizard_eye %actor.name% set item 1 while %item% <= 4 quest variable wizard_eye %actor.name% item%item% 0 eval item %item% + 1 done nod msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'This seems to be all of them.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'O Rhalean, show me the balance of Justice!' emote utters a few words of power! wait 2s msend %actor% The four orbs begin to &7&bglow&0! msend %actor% They become fully transparent and colorless. wait 3s emote scrutinizes the four now identical mystic orbs. wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Yes I see...' emote picks up one of the four clear crystal balls. mload obj 55033 give crystal-ball %actor.name% wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'This will be your window to the universe.' wait 2s bow %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'May Justice follow you always.' else nod msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'And the rest?' endif endif endif

triggers.name: wizard_eye_shaman_sleep
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% == 12 return 0 wait 1s msend %actor% A hazy dreamscape appears before you. mecho msend %actor% The Great Snow Leopard comes into focus! msend %actor% The Great Snow Leopard says, 'Come, follow where I walk.' wait 2s msend %actor% The Great Snow Leopard leads you on a journey through crisp, cold, snowy mountains... wait 3s msend %actor% hot burning deserts, sweltering jungles of sweet scented flowers... wait 3s msend %actor% distant mysterious islands of alien sounds... wait 3s msend %actor% through cities of people speaking languages you do not understand... wait 6s msend %actor% Soaring through the open sky, the Great Snow Leopard roars to shake the heavens! mecho msend %actor% In the echoes of the roar, you can see shape distant lands! msend %actor% The nature of the spell becomes clear! quest complete wizard_eye %actor.name% mskillset %actor% wizard eye msend %actor% &6&bYou have learned Wizard Eye!&0 else return 0 endif

triggers.name: wizard_eye_status_checker
triggers.commands: set stage %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% set item1 %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item1]% set item2 %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item2]% set item3 %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item3]% set item4 %actor.quest_variable[wizard_eye:item4]% wait 2 if %actor.has_completed[wizard_eye]% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You already have the sight of the Great Snow Leopard.' halt endif switch %stage% case 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You are trying to find the &6&bgypsy witch in South Caelia Highlands.  Ask her about Wizard Eye.&0' halt break case 2 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'The gypsy witch says to find &3&bmarigold poultice&0 from a healer on the beachhead.' halt break case 3 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Go visit the &6&bSeer of Griffin Isle&0 to see what you need to do next.  &6&bAsk her about Wizard Eye&0.' halt break case 4 set who her set visit have the Seer make you an herbal sachet set thing1 %get.obj_shortdesc[2329]% set thing2 %get.obj_shortdesc[23753]% set thing3 %get.obj_shortdesc[48005]% break case 5 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Give me the sachet.' halt break case 6 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You are looking for &6&bthe apothecary in Anduin&0.' halt break case 7 set who her set visit get The Green Woman to make you incense set thing1 %get.obj_shortdesc[23754]% set thing2 %get.obj_shortdesc[3298]% set thing3 %get.obj_shortdesc[23847]% set thing4 %get.obj_shortdesc[18001]% break case 8 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Give me the incense.' halt break case 9 case 10 set who him set thing1 %get.obj_shortdesc[3218]% set thing2 %get.obj_shortdesc[53424]% set thing3 %get.obj_shortdesc[43021]% set thing4 %get.obj_shortdesc[4003]% set visit see the Oracle of Justice break case 11 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Give me the crystal ball.' halt break case 12 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'All you need to do now is lay back and go to &6&bsleep&0.' halt break default msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Progress on what spell?  I am not guiding you.' halt done msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You need to %visit%. if %item1% || %item2% || %item3% || %item4% msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You have already given %who%: if %item1% msend %actor% - %thing1% endif if %item2% msend %actor% - %thing2% endif if %item3% msend %actor% - %thing3% endif if %item4% msend %actor% - %thing4% endif endif msend %actor% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You still need to bring %who%: if !%item1% msend %actor% - &3&b%thing1%&0 endif if !%item2% msend %actor% - &3&b%thing2%&0 endif if !%item3% msend %actor% - &3&b%thing3%&0 endif if %stage% != 4 if !%item4% msend %actor% - &3&b%thing4%&0 endif endif

triggers.name: Wizard Eye Master Shaman receive 2
triggers.commands: set stage %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% if %stage% == 5 wait 2 mjunk sachet quest advance wizard_eye %actor.name% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Very smart blend of herbs.  It will bring prophetic dreams.  She always did know her sachets.' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I will store it for you.' msend %actor% %self.name% tucks the herbal sachet away in her chamber. wait 5s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I believe it's time to &6&bvisit the witchy woman who runs the apothecary in Anduin&0.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Like the others you have visited, she has no name any can recall, simply going by "the Green Woman."' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Though she may not look like much, she is both a powerful diviner and a master of secrets.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Other peoples' secrets.  Which she sells to the highest bidder.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'See what she recommends.  Surely she has a trick or two up her sleeve.' endif

triggers.name: Wizard Eye Master Shaman receive 3
triggers.commands: set stage %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% if %stage% == 8 wait 2 quest advance wizard_eye %actor.name% mjunk %object.name% emote smells the cinnamon-rose blend. msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Ahhh, what a gorgeous fragrance!' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Cinnamon and rose both open the third eye andincrease psychic awareness.  And I would never have thought to use powdered sapphire in an incense.  Very clever.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I shall put this with the other necessaries.' msend %actor% %self.name% tucks the incense away in her chamber. wait 6s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'It looks like you have everything prepared.  Now for the most difficult part.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I have been scrying on my cauldron to determine the final steps of your journey.  I believe I have located &3&bfour potential orbs&0 to serve as your crystal ball.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Unfortunately, I'm not sure which of the four will be best suited to you: msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% &0- First is a simple &3&bquartz ball&0. msend %actor% &0  But be careful!  It is in the possession of a priest of Blackmourne in Anduin, and they are as dangerous as they are homicidal. msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% &0- Second is an &3&borb of pure Chaos&0. msend %actor% &0  It is kept by the Beast of Borgan, which dwells in the Layveran Labyrinth in the Black Ice Desert. msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% &0- Third is the &3&bOrb of Catastrophe&0. msend %actor% &0  Cyprianum the Reaper, the ruler of Demise Keep in the Syric Mountains lays claim to that one. msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% &0- Fourth is a &3&bglass globe&0 which controls the flow of time. msend %actor% &0  The mysterious Time Elemental Lord, stranded in Frost Valley after the Time Cataclysm, carries this one.' wait 6s msend %actor% %self.name% says, '&6&bGather all four and bring them to the Oracle of Justice&0 at our sister pyramid in the ancient forest near Anduin.  Only he can tell you which is best for you.' wait 3s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Once the proper choice has been determined, bring the final selection back to me.  I will lead you through the full casting process.' endif

triggers.name: Wizard Eye Master Shaman receive 4
triggers.commands: set stage %actor.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% if %stage% == 11 wait 2 quest advance wizard_eye %actor.name% emote admires the crystal ball. msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Truly a perfect tool for scrying.  It suits you.  Keep it and treasure it.' give crystal-ball %actor.name% wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Everything is prepared!' emote retrieves the poultice, the sachet, and the incense. wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'First, the poultice.' emote scoops up some of the pungent poultice and smears it on the crystal ball. wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Now your turn %actor.name%' msend %actor% %self.name% spreads the stinky poultice across your face.  Yuck! mechoaround %actor% %self.name% spreads the stinky poultice across %actor.name%'s face. mforce %actor% gag wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Next the sachet.' emote lays out a pillow and places the herbal sachet beneath it. wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'And now, the incense.' emote lights the incense. msend %actor% The sweet smell of roses and cinnamon fills the chamber. wait 4s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Now, all that's left is for you to &6&bsleep&0, %actor.name%.' endif

rooms.name: A Chamber of Ice
rooms.description: There is a small opening in the icy wall in the rear of the chamber, behind a small ice sculpture.  There is barely enough head room above to stand fully, even for a short person.  There is a terrible chill in the room, emanating from the artificially made ice of the alcove.

extras.text: A seemingly solid sheet of whirling snow challenges you to proceed!

rooms.name: The Icy Ledge
rooms.description: You stand near the edge of a large gorge in the ice.  The wind continues to knock you almost to your knees.  You question your sanity as you proceed along this narrow path.  The way east seems easiest to travel.

East.description: A wall of blowing ice seems to engulf existence itself!

West.description: The way westward seems to be closed by the vicious storm. You wonder if you can escape this path you have chosen.

extras.text: The way westward seems to be closed by the vicious storm! You wonder if you can escape this path.
A seemingly solid sheet of whirling snow challenges you to proceed!

rooms.name: The Icy Ledge
rooms.description: You are coming closer to the edge of a large gorge in the ice.  You seem to notice a structure of some sort to the east.  The winds here are still rough and cold, but subside partially to the east.  The way north and south look blocked by the crevice walls.

East.description: The wind blows cold and hard like a bad fiction novel! But the way seems clearer.

South.description: It is too dark to tell...... Is that another crack in the ice?

West.description: As you look you wonder if you could possibly survive the torrents of ice blazing through the crevice.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Icy Ledge
rooms.description: You have come to the edge of an icy gorge.  A huge crevice opens below you. You now realize this is a glacier you have entered.  To the east below you... Amazing, there is a large structure recently uncovered by the opening in the glacier.  You see a huge sloping black granite wall towering above the ice floor.  You notice a large pure white statue of some kind on the top of the wall.  The way down is a sheer wall of solid ice.  You struggle to stand and not fall to your death.  The way west is your only option.

West.description: The maelstrom grows in strength in this direction.

rooms.name: A Tunnel Opening
rooms.description: You have slipped through a narrow opening in the wall of ice into what looks like the opening of a tunnel of sorts.  The ice chills you still, but it is warmer here as you take refuge from the winds.  The tunnel continues downward, and the exit north is more apparent from this side.

North.description: There seems to be more light there. You notice a storm raging!

Down.description: It gets darker and surprisingly warmer.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: An Icen Tunnel
rooms.description: Climbing down the crack in the ice you notice a distinct tunnel to the east. The temperature here is cold but bearable in comparison to the surface.  You look upward and notice the treacherous climb and wonder if you should turn back now.  The ice here is mysterious and foreboding, seeming almost alive...

East.description: The darkness seems to swallow up the ice, but the way is clear.

Up.description: Although the climb looks impossible you notice it has been done many times by the path up the ice. You wonder what could motivate anyone to make such a climb.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: An Icen Tunnel
rooms.description: You have entered a distinct tunnel.  It looks as though it was intentionally created.  By who though?  The walls are smooth to the touch and the ice is a solid white in color, it reflects all the light of your lightsource.  You can hear a muffled sound to the east.

East.description: The darkness seems to swallow up the ice, but the way is clear.

West.description: There is more light this way.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: An Icen Tunnel
rooms.description: This part of the tunnels seems like all the rest, except with more exits. You continue to notice a muffled sound of activity from somewhere, but it echoes throughout the entire tunnel.  There are exits all around.

rooms.description: The view down is breathtaking as your light isn't strong enough to let you see the bottom of this fissure.  You find that you have no footing!

rooms.name: The Tunnel Entrance
rooms.description: This tunnel has been smoothly formed somehow.  It is warmer here than outside in the wind.  You hear the activity of a large number of people to the east, outside and through a gate.  You wonder how anyone could survive in the cold.  The only exits are to the east and west.

East.description: Looking out of the tunnel you notice a courtyard behind a gatehouse of granite.

West.description: It gets darker within the tunnels, but you notice a strange light far to the west.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Technitzitlan Gatehouse
rooms.description: You stand before a huge black granite gatehouse with many strange and deformed symbols carved into it.  Large ebony doors swing weakly from the columns.  You hear a group of people from within.  On the top of the gatehouse is a solid white statue of a giant cat in mid-pounce with claws flaring. Because of the snowdrifts and ice the only way is back into the tunnel or through the gate.

East.description: You see a busy courtyard with strangely dressed men practicing battle with each other.

West.description: You see that the gatehouse is almost flush with the ice face. Inside the tunnel is completely dark.

extras.text: The symbols on the columns seem to be tribal in nature, maybe an offering to their gods for a peaceful visit.
You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Technitzitlan Courtyard
rooms.description: You step through the gatehouse and are overwhelmed by an open courtyard dominated by a huge stepping black granite pyramid wall to the east.  Ice apparently engulfs the rest of the pyramid but you notice another crack in the southeast corner of the courtyard.  Many people carry on activity here.  You wonder in amazement how these people survive in the snow and harsh weather.  A wall of ice flows north and south forming a natural western ice wall for the courtyard.  Paths in the snow continue in all directions.

North.description: The courtyard opens this way along the ice wall. You notice a structure far across the yard to the north protruding from an east-west flowing wall of ice making a northern border to the courtyard.

East.description: The courtyard opens up this way and you notice that at the side of the pyramid there is a ramp leading up to a small landing.

South.description: The courtyard opens this way, but in the distance another sheer wall of east-west flowing ice blocks passage to the south.

West.description: An entrance to the ice wall can be seen through the gatehouse.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

As you look at the granite slabs of the pyramid closely you notice many odd symbols that seem to tell many tells of the history of this kingdom. You notice protrusions of columns just to the north of you along the pyramid wall.

You notice protrusions of columns just to the north of you along the pyramid wall.  To the east at what looks like a corner of the pyramid, there is an opening in the ice much smaller than a tunnel, more like a crack.  Paths in the snow continue to the north, west and east.

North.description: The courtyard opens this way. You notice a structure far across the yard.

East.description: You look down a well trodden path in the snow as it disappears into what lookslike a narrow crevice. It looks as though you could maybe squeeze in to explore.

rooms.name: The Guard's Steps

There is a path in the snow leading to the west back into the courtyard.

West.description: You notice activity in the courtyard.

Up.description: You are almost blinded by the wind and snow.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Shaman Steps
rooms.description: As you make your way below the cauldron the mist follows you through a tunnel that hasn't been traveled for what looks like thousands of years. There is crushed stone and rubble everywhere and the passage is difficult. You notice it is much colder down here and you question your sanity as you wonder what could be in this dark forgotten place.

rooms.name: The Crevice
rooms.description: You walk down a path in the snow and realize you are between two sheer and uneven ice walls.  There is no wind here and the trail grows darker as little sunlight reaches down into the crevice.  The formation of this passage looks unnatural as if caused by a strange magical force breaking the ice open. Paths through the ice and snow continue to the west and south.

South.description: The way looks dark and foreboding but you notice footprints in the snow.

West.description: Light eminates from the courtyard.

rooms.name: The Leopard Guardhouse

The walls of the room are the same black granite as the rest of the structures you've noticed.  The walls are carved with many symbols, these seem to represent some form of order and regimentation.  There are exits to the east, north and south.

South.description: The courtyard is this way and the wind blows coldly through the doorway.

rooms.name: The Leopard Guard Quarters
rooms.description: This room of the structure is long and narrow.  What looks like small beds line each wall.  Strange symbols are carved into the wall just like the rest of this place.  The only exit is to the south.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Armoury
rooms.description: This room off to the side of the guardhouse has many weapon racks and shelves that look as though they may have held shields at one time.  The only exit is to the west.

rooms.name: The Base of the Pyramid
rooms.description: Standing at the bottom of a long stairway you realize that this is the base of the front of this pyramid.  Statues of a cat adorn the base of the steps. Many symbols are carved into the steps as though small individual statuesque monsters actually make the walkway.  The ice covered steps continue up and a dark path continues to the south into an ice crevice.

rooms.name: The Steps of the Pyramid
rooms.description: As you traverse the steep grade of the steps you struggle not to slip on the ice and snow that coats the granite of the pyramid.  Sheer ice walls surround the beginning of the steps.  Looking up to the top you can see the edge of the large white statue of the cat.  There is a light path through the snow and ice as if others have traveled this way.  There seems to be more activity eminating from the top of the pyramid.  The steps continue up and down.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

It steps much like the rest and you notice a periodic block protruding from the walls away from the steps you are on.  They must be smaller statues buried in centuries of ice.  Looking up to the top you can see the large white statue of the cat.  There is a light path through the snow and ice as if others have traveled this way.  There seems to be more activity eminating from the top of the pyramid.  The steps continue south and up.

rooms.name: Top of the Steps
rooms.description: You stand in the ice and look out over the side of a large pyramid buried in an endless sea of white.  From here you can see almost the entire front side of this part of the pyramid.  It has steps much like the rest and you notice a periodic block protruding from the walls away from the steps you are on. There must be smaller statues buried in centuries of ice.  Looking across the top you can see the large white statue of the giant snow leopard.  There is a light path through the snow and ice as if others have traveled this way. Large columns surround this part of the top of the pyramid and a hallway opens to the north between the columns.  There seems to be more activity eminating from north of here.  The steps continue downward and a path continues to the north.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Technitzitlan Plaza
rooms.description: A massive ice wall extends hundreds of feet above the top of the pyramid, consuming most of the surrounding area.  You notice how the walls of ice narrow as the crevice closes just north of here.  Sunlight penetrates between the ice walls and would keep the area vaguely warm if the wind weren't blowing so fiercely.  Snow and ice dominate life here, and it looks as though it would be difficult for anyone to survive in this harsh climate.  North of here you see the large statue of the snow leopard and notice a table below it.  Paths between the columns continue in all directions.

North.description: You see a giant statue of a white cat with black spots dominating the plaza. It looks as though there may be an exit of some kind on the other side.

East.description: A path leads to darkness between the columns.

South.description: A path leads between columns to the front of the pyramid.

West.description: A path leads to darkness between the columns.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Technitzitlan Plaza
rooms.description: This hallway looks as though it would make a square around the altar you noticed to the north.  However, the ice of centuries of cold engulfs the hall to the east.  The only passage is back to the west.

West.description: An intersection in the halls can be seen this way.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Technitzitlan Plaza
rooms.description: This part of the plaza looks to be a simple hallway of columns that encircles the altar you noticed to the north.  The columns continue to the north and to the east.

North.description: The path grows darker.

East.description: An intersection in the halls can be seen this way.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Technitzitlan Plaza
rooms.description: This hallway looks as though it would make a square around the altar you noticed to the north.  However, the ice of centuries of cold engulfs the hall to the north.  The passage continues north into the cold and southward back into some light.

North.description: Darkness engulfs the path ahead.

South.description: There is more light in this direction.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Technitzitlan Plaza
rooms.description: This hallway looks as if it were intended to form a square around the altar which now lies directly to the east, but the ice made from centuries of cold engulfs the hall here, blocking passage to the north.  The only passage is back to the south.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Altar of Sacrifice
rooms.description: Stepping away from the protection of the columns the wind bites into you harder than you've noticed before.  As you stand near the center of the plaza snow and ice creep upon you.  A large table sits in the center just in front of a statue of the giant snow leopard.  It looks as though this altar hasn't been used in a long time.  A light path through the ice and snow continues to the north under the snow leopard's statue.  There are smaller statues of men arranged in a ceremonial pattern surrounding the altar's table.  The only other exit is to the south.

South.description: The courtyard opens this way, but in the distance another sheer wall of ice blocks passage.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Jade Portal
rooms.description: As you stand under the giant statue you are behind the altar and notice a ramp leading downward through the ice and snow.  At the bottom of the ramp you see a monstrous portal made of solid jade.  The portal isn't visible from the altar and you wonder why it's placed where it is?  The guards seem irritated at your presence as the cold continues to bite into you.

South.description: Looking back under the statue you see the altar of sacrifice.

Down.description: You look upon a magnificent piece of artwork. The jade alone would be priceless!

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Altar Steps

You notice it's warmer here than outside and there is no ice here.  Torches are placed along the wall to light the way.  The only exits are up and north.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Hall of Shaman

The walls of this hallway are carved with many symbols.  You hear activity in the hall but its origin you are unable to determine.  The hall continues to the west and east.  There are steps to the south.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Hall of Shaman
rooms.description: The mist on the floor flows thinly from the east, and is barely noticeable. The temperature drops noticeably in this section of hallway, and you notice that ice is starting to form on the walls again to the north burying the light of the torches.  The hallway continues to the north and east.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Hall of Shaman
rooms.description: A pile of ice and rubble is all that is left of the northern part of the passage.  It is cold here and ice covers everything.  The passage continues to the south.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Hall of Shaman

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Hall of Shaman

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Hall of Shaman

extras.text: You see a mighty female mage holding a key. This Shaman seems to beckon you to her.

rooms.name: The Hall of Shaman

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Hall of Shaman

The symbols show how the people of this land conquered two great monsters with the assistance of a great cat.  It looks as though the cat helped two groups of the people defeat the monsters.  One group used magic and the other brute force.  The cat imprisoned the creatures to protect the people. The symbols continue along the hallway to the west and south.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Hall of Shaman

The most noticeable symbol in the wall is one of a giant white cat with black spots.  It looks as though the people of this land worship this leopard.  The passageway continues to the east.

extras.text: You seem to be losing this snowball fight.

rooms.name: The Leopard Shaman Sanctuary
rooms.description: You have entered a wide open room with many statues lining the walls.  The statues in the center of each wall are that of The Great Snow Leopard. Statues of warriors dressed in leather and skins dominate the walls, but there is an occasional statue of men dressed in robes wielding staffs of destruction. There is a long ebony table here as if meetings take place here.  A huge cauldron is the centerpiece of the room.  Mist flows from the cauldron.

rooms.name: The Leopard Steps
